title: Welsh couple are found murdered in south Africa - BBC News
text:
Welsh couple are found murdered in south Africa 21 February 2017 Image caption Christine and Roger Solik A couple from south Wales have been found murdered in South Africa. 
Christine Solik, 57, who is originally from Mountain Ash, was found bound and murdered 50 miles (80km) from her home in the Kwazulu-Natal province on 17 February. 
The body of her husband Roger, 66, who suffered from Parkinson's disease, was found near her on Monday. 
Police in South Africa believe the couple had been kidnapped from their home during a robbery on Friday. 
The couple married in Wales in 1980 and moved to South Africa the following year. 'Inseparable' 
Their four children issued a statement urging people for help after the robbery, confirming their mother had been killed. 
"Our parents were inseparable and their relationship was something to aspire to," it read. 
"It is hard to understand that on their community farmland estate, with rolling hills and endless nature, and neighbours 100m away, that something so violent could happen. Please keep us in your thoughts and prayers." 
Mrs Solik had returned to Wales for the funeral of her father, Glyn Savage, last month. 
The couple, who also had two grandchildren, initially emigrated on a two-year visa, but decided to stay in South Africa. Related Topics
